snippet: Eastern European nations have called for an assertive response from NATO in the face of an aggressive Russia, but many of those countries have not met the military spending commitments that come with NATO membership.
abstract: Eastern European nations have been among loudest in calling for more assertive response from NATO to Russia's annexation of Crimea; many of the same countries have not met the military spending commitments that come with NATO membership or still have long way to go in building kind of military strength necessary to deter Russia.

byline.contributor: Joanna Berendt contributed reporting from Lask, Poland.

lead_paragraph: Eastern European nations have called for an assertive response from NATO in the face of an aggressive Russia, but many of those countries have not met the military spending commitments that come with NATO membership.

headline.main: Across Eastern Europe, Military Spending Lags
headline.print_headline: Across Eastern Europe, Military Spending Lags
